data.title: ui::ScrollView scrollBarWidth and scrollBarAutoHideTime not working as expected
data.body:
- Cocos2d-x v 3.11.1
- Android 6.0
  
  Hi,
  I am using scrollView.

```
ui::ScrollView *scrollView = ui::ScrollView::create();
scrollView->setDirection(ui::ScrollView::Direction:: VERTICAL);
scrollView->setScrollBarColor(Color3B(Color4F(someColor)));
scrollView->setScrollBarWidth(60.0f);
scrollView->setScrollBarAutoHideTime(3.0f)
.
.
.
this->addChild(scrollView, 1);
```

`setScrollBarWidth` is not working.
Whatever value I give, it changes from the default width to some particular width irrespective of float width I pass as parameter. Eg- the width is same for float value 60.f or 15.0f.

`setScrollBarAutoHideTime` and `setScrollBarColor` don't work until the scrollView is added in the layer.

Please check and fix the issue.
Thanks :)

data.title: Fix typos in comments and strings

data.title: C API
data.body:
This is still WIP, but I wanted to bring it to the devs attention so I know my work won't be in vain. Have a C API is very important for interoperability with other languages (like Swift). You can checkout my Swift (no ObjC) layer for Cocos2D-X.

[Swift Repo](https://github.com/PureSwift/Cocos2D)
[Forum Discussion](http://discuss.cocos2d-x.org/t/discussion-adding-open-source-swift-to-cocos2d-x/21979/10)

data.title: Lua: add cc.vec3 functions - add, sub, mul and dot
data.body: Also update the lua test to use these functions.

data.title: Setting a sprite frame containing polygon data discards the sprite's current color
data.body:
After setting a new SpriteFrame containing polygon data via sprite->setSpriteFrame, the sprite's color will be reset to white until updating the color again.

The issue can be fixed by adding updateColor() after copying the polygon data in setSpriteFrame

See patch:
[update_sprite_color.patch.txt](https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/files/529709/update_sprite_color.patch.txt)

data.title: AssetsManagerEx: incomplete error handling
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.9+

Steps to Reproduce:
1. use compressed assets with AssetsManager
2. make any error during decompression happen (malformed or zero-length zip file, out of storage space)
3. as result, you'll get a game with corrupted assets

There is no error handling logic in decompression phase. Originally I was using cocos2d-js 3.9, but already looked at 3.13 source code. If any decompression error occurs, it just deletes downloaded zip file, temp manifest and so on. So after a restart, you'll get a game with corrupted/incomplete assets, incremented version and no obvious way to even detect this.

I've temporary fixed this in bundled LoaderScene by storing a flag into local storage about starting/successfully finishing update procedure and exposed to JSB a method to delete all downloaded content in case of any failure, so AssetsManager will try to download everything again.

Btw, because all decompressing is happening as a final step and there is no information about progress of this process, on "slow" devices this process can take up to several minutes (we have ~200Mb images) without any visual feedback to the player.

data.title: Adds test case for PR #16689 (fix font rendering position)
data.body: Adds test case for PR #16689 (fix font rendering position)

data.title: Sprite scale9
data.body:
Adds support for "sliced 9" sprite to `Sprite`.  This will deprecate `Scale9Sprite`.

It adds two new APIs to `Sprite`:
- `setCenterRect(Rect())`  // in pixel coordinates
- `setCenterRectNormalized(Rect())`   // in normalized coordinates (from 0 to 1)

To stretch the sprite, just call `sprite->setContentSize()`.
`setContentSize()` will stretch the sprite both in 9-slice mode, or "normal" mode.

data.title: Add reason for edit end to UIEditBoxDelegate
Add Horizontal Text Alignment to UIEditBox
Fix indentation
data.body: This fixes a minor indentation issue in HttpRequest.

data.title: Remove unused local variable
data.body:
Hello, I get this warning when compiling libcocos2d with Xcode 8.0:

```
cocos/2d/CCAutoPolygon.cpp:555:10: unused variable 'end' [-Wunused-variable]
```

This PR removes an unused variable `end` (which was used for iterating vector before commit cdee1e1) and fixes it.

Thanks!

data.title: V3:WinRT disable /Zw on .c file
data.body: This pull requests fixes the Windows 10 UWP version. The /Zw compiler option must be disabled for .c files.

data.title: Hot update Err
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.13.1
- devices test on:
- developing environments
  - NDK version: r12b
  - Xcode version:
  - VS version:
  - browser type and version:

use patch update
Those are the log:

```
热更新失败事件：更新过程中遇到错误 { CURLECode = -3, CURLMCode = 0, assetId = "src/modules/gang/view/GangLayer.luac", eventCodeId = 7, eventCodeName = "ERROR_UPDATING", message = "java.io.InterruptedIOException: Connection has been shut down", percent = 0, percentByFile = 15.75757598877 }
热更新失败事件：更新过程中遇到错误 { CURLECode = -3, CURLMCode = 0, assetId = "src/modules/widgets/view/WidgetsPlayerLvUp.luac", eventCodeId = 7, eventCodeName = "ERROR_UPDATING", message = "java.net.SocketTimeoutException", percent = 0, percentByFile = 97.575759887695 } 
```

**The most happen is `message = "java.net.SocketTimeoutException"` , do it http server's business ?**
**And Those are the crash**:

```
#00 pc ./cocos2d-x/extensions/assets-manager/AssetsManagerEx.cpp:642) [armeabi-v5te]

4 #03 pc ./cocos2d-x/cocos//network/CCDownloader-android.cpp:171) [armeabi-v5te]
```

It happen in hundreds of devices, please give some help.

data.title: Activity issues after launch app first time, from play store, ... and reopening from icon on Android
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.13( with minor fixes from 3.13.1 and 3.14)
  (included, we were already in this situation: _https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/pull/16525/commits/eeac95c40f7a81c0158f44dc275c27f009cbd915_)
- devices test on: Huawei p8, OnePlus 2
- developing environments
  - NDK version: r10e

Steps to Reproduce:
1.  Integrate something able to start new activity from your app (we are currently using sdkbox iap, play, appodeal that starts new activity),
2.  Run/Compile,Install,Start your app
3.  When app start start new activity (ex in my case. play video for appodeal, show achievements, ...)
4.  Return to device home without close app
5.  Re-open app using icon
6.  Note that activity has been stopped

The problem seems to be related to android issues reported in this answer: _http://stackoverflow.com/a/16447508_

I managed to solve with answer workaround, but unfortunately i'm totally inexperienced in android activities. Note that with these steps the issue will only be present first time you install and launch the app, if you restart this doesn't happen. There are others methods for this to happen as for example launch the app from play store, return on device home without close, clicking app icon.

- developing environments
  - NDK version: r10e
  - Android Studio 2.2.1

1. Create a new game with cocos command line
2. Open project in Android Studio and try to run it in the simulator
